title: Next version
data:
The next major version of NetHack is very likely to be [NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

There is no information about when it will be released, other than "When it's ready"; the [DevTeam](/wiki/DevTeam "DevTeam") has a policy of not announcing release schedules. [\[2\]](#cite_note-2) Anyone is free to [hazard a guess](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version_pool "NetHackWiki:Next version pool"), though.

After the release of [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") in 2003, the NetHack [DevTeam](/wiki/DevTeam "DevTeam") went on a long hiatus. 3.4.3 was long [considered by some](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version_pool_3.4.3#Never "NetHackWiki:Next version pool 3.4.3") to be the final version of NetHack until December 7, 2015, twelve years after this version's release, when [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0") was released.

There are also various actively developed [variants](/wiki/Variant "Variant") by different developers that build on [NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack") and could be considered a "next version" of NetHack in the same way as [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d") was to [Hack 1.0.3](/wiki/Hack_1.0.3 "Hack 1.0.3").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Leaked 3.5.0 source code](#Leaked_3.5.0_source_code)
- [2 NetHack 4 confusion](#NetHack_4_confusion)
- [3 See also](#See_also)
- [4 References](#References)

## Leaked 3.5.0 source code

In September 2014, a leaked source code distribution described as "NetHack 3.5.0 Beta" was circulated on the Internet, e.g. in the Usenet newsgroup [rec.games.roguelike.nethack](/wiki/Rec.games.roguelike.nethack "Rec.games.roguelike.nethack"). In response, the DevTeam posted an official announcement on [nethack.org](https://nethack.org) confirming the leak, but refuting any claims that it would represent an official release (beta or otherwise), and also retiring the version numbers 3.4.4 and 3.5, which had been incorrectly associated with the leaked code:

> Recently a NetHack source distribution has appeared, claiming to be NetHack 3.5 or 3.5.0 or 3.4.4.
>
> This claim is partially correct. This is our code. However it was not released by us or with our authorization. This code is not ready for release: it is unfinished, unpolished, and almost certainly very buggy. It has not been play-tested for balance or functionality. It is best considered a partial and unfinished rough draft. We will not be supporting this code, nor will we be releasing binaries or bugfixes for it. It will not be available through our website.
>
> Due to this incident and to prevent confusion, we will not now nor in the future release anything with a version number of 3.4.4, 3.5, or 3.5.0.

Discussion about this leaked code can be found in the article [leaked development version](/wiki/Leaked_development_version "Leaked development version").

## NetHack 4 confusion

There is a variant of NetHack 3.4.3 known as [NetHack 4](/wiki/NetHack_4 "NetHack 4"), which is not an official version 4 of NetHack from the DevTeam. More confusingly, [Ais523](/wiki/User:Ais523 "User:Ais523"), the maintainer of NetHack4, is now on the DevTeam but works on NetHack4 and vanilla separately.

Unlike most other variants, NetHack4 has a drastically different codebase from vanilla, and the DevTeam internally refers to it as NetHack4, with no space. It is not actually version 4 of NetHack, and no such version currently exists.

## See also

- [Bugs in NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/Bugs_in_NetHack_3.6.0 "Bugs in NetHack 3.6.0")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) <https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack>
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) <https://nethack.org/common/info.html#B2>

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Next version

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The next major version of NetHack is very likely to be NetHack 3.7.0.[1]

There is no information about when it will be released, other than "When it's ready"; the DevTeam has a policy of not announcing release schedules. [2] Anyone is free to hazard a guess, though.

After the release of NetHack 3.4.3 in 2003, the NetHack DevTeam went on a long hiatus. 3.4.3 was long considered by some to be the final version of NetHack until December 7, 2015, twelve years after this version's release, when NetHack 3.6.0 was released.

There are also various actively developed variants by different developers that build on NetHack and could be considered a "next version" of NetHack in the same way as NetHack 1.3d was to Hack 1.0.3.

Contents

  • 1 Leaked 3.5.0 source code
  • 2 NetHack 4 confusion
  • 3 See also
  • 4 References

Leaked 3.5.0 source code

In September 2014, a leaked source code distribution described as "NetHack 3.5.0 Beta" was circulated on the Internet, e.g. in the Usenet newsgroup rec.games.roguelike.nethack. In response, the DevTeam posted an official announcement on nethack.org confirming the leak, but refuting any claims that it would represent an official release (beta or otherwise), and also retiring the version numbers 3.4.4 and 3.5, which had been incorrectly associated with the leaked code:

Recently a NetHack source distribution has appeared, claiming to be NetHack 3.5 or 3.5.0 or 3.4.4.

This claim is partially correct. This is our code. However it was not released by us or with our authorization. This code is not ready for release: it is unfinished, unpolished, and almost certainly very buggy. It has not been play-tested for balance or functionality. It is best considered a partial and unfinished rough draft. We will not be supporting this code, nor will we be releasing binaries or bugfixes for it. It will not be available through our website.

Due to this incident and to prevent confusion, we will not now nor in the future release anything with a version number of 3.4.4, 3.5, or 3.5.0.

Discussion about this leaked code can be found in the article leaked development version.

NetHack 4 confusion

There is a variant of NetHack 3.4.3 known as NetHack 4, which is not an official version 4 of NetHack from the DevTeam. More confusingly, Ais523, the maintainer of NetHack4, is now on the DevTeam but works on NetHack4 and vanilla separately.

Unlike most other variants, NetHack4 has a drastically different codebase from vanilla, and the DevTeam internally refers to it as NetHack4, with no space. It is not actually version 4 of NetHack, and no such version currently exists.

See also

  • Bugs in NetHack 3.6.0

References

  1. ↑ https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack
  2. ↑ https://nethack.org/common/info.html#B2

There are also various actively developed [[variant]]s by different developers that build on [[NetHack]] and could be considered a "next version" of NetHack in the same way as [[NetHack 1.3d]] was to [[Hack 1.0.3]]. ==Leaked 3.5.0 source code== In September 2014, a leaked source code distribution described as "NetHack 3.5.0 Beta" was circulated on the Internet, e.g. in the Usenet newsgroup [[rec.games.roguelike.nethack]]. In response, the DevTeam posted an official announcement on [https://nethack.org nethack.org] confirming the leak, but refuting any claims that it would represent an official release (beta or otherwise), and also retiring the version numbers 3.4.4 and 3.5, which had been incorrectly associated with the leaked code:
Recently a NetHack source distribution has appeared, claiming to be NetHack 3.5 or 3.5.0 or 3.4.4. This claim is partially correct. This is our code. However it was not released by us or with our authorization. This code is not ready for release: it is unfinished, unpolished, and almost certainly very buggy. Due to this incident and to prevent confusion, we will not now nor in the future release anything with a version number of 3.4.4, 3.5, or 3.5.0.
Discussion about this leaked code can be found in the article [[leaked development version]]. ==NetHack 4 confusion== There is a variant of NetHack 3.4.3 known as [[NetHack 4]], which is not an official version 4 of NetHack from the DevTeam. Unlike most other variants, NetHack4 has a drastically different codebase from vanilla, and the DevTeam internally refers to it as NetHack4, with no space. It is not actually version 4 of NetHack, and no such version currently exists. ==See also== *[[Bugs in NetHack 3.6.0]] ==References== {{nethack-367}} [[Category:Development]]
